html:
Feb 11 (Reuters) - The following are the top stories in the Wall Street Journal. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.


- The U.S. Food and Drug Administration on Thursday denied a petition by short sellers to halt clinical trials of an experimental Alzheimer's drug being developed by Cassava Sciences Inc SAVA.O. https://on.wsj.com/3LkGdax


- Zendesk Inc ZEN.N, the software company under activist shareholder pressure to abandon its $3.9 billion all-stock acquisition of the parent of online survey portal SurveyMonkey MNTV.O, said on Thursday it had rejected an acquisition offer from a consortium of private equity firms for as much $16 billion. https://on.wsj.com/34zaGRp


- Comcast Corp's CMCSA.O NBCUniversal is finalizing a plan that would drastically change its partnership with Hulu, shifting high-profile programming to its own Peacock streaming platform. https://on.wsj.com/3sC1RP3


- Amazon.com Inc AMZN.O on Thursday informed staff at its U.S. warehouses that it will allow fully vaccinated employees to go maskless inside of its warehouses and is taking steps to adjust its paid time off policies. https://on.wsj.com/34KKljc


(Compiled by Bengaluru newsroom)

(( globalnewsmonitoring@thomsonreuters.com ))
